header.title: The First Leap to Realize a New Breeze
header.description: A personal brand developed to introduce a web developer with four key competencies

outline.label: Overview
outline.description: <0>Planning Intent</0><1>Renewed personal brand site from the existing portfolio site. Redesigned with new planning, added animation effects, and changed the page rendering method to server-side. In the UI planning stage, Apple's Human Interface Guideline was reflected in the design. The goal was to provide users entering my page with an intuitive and consistent experience, considering a possible release of services under my brand name in the future.</1><2>The reason for changing from Plain React to NextJS is solely for server-side rendering. Nebaram's web is expected to grow significantly. Considering the impact on user experience with continued addition of complex animations and data bundles in a single-page web using CSR, we decided to change the rendering method together. </2>

implements.label: Implemented Features
description: <0>Common</0><1>Scroll/mouse animation, motion slider, multilingual routing and translation, server-side rendering, responsive web screen, PWA</1>

issues.label: Issues
issues.description: <0>SEO and Performance Improvement</0><1>The initial page had a First Contentful Paint (FCP) of 2.5 seconds, Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) index of 0.6, and a very low Search Engine Optimization (SEO) index of 68, making it vulnerable to exposure frequency. Analyzing five performance indicators to improve, we applied and summarized improvement methods. For better user experience, we analyzed three representative websites in terms of UI/UX. In terms of performance, all images were compressed to 30KB or less, more than 2 times, and the size and ratio were fixed to block layout changes. Additionally, image descriptions, sitemap, and page-specific metadata were added, and loading feedback for large images such as GIFs was provided. From the rendering aspect, we changed the layout to prerender on the server side, reducing the time it takes for the page to load. In terms of user experience, providing a unified font, distinct sizes, and a limited color palette minimized confusion and created immediate feedback based on the user's movement using transitions. As a result, the average index of the five performance indicators improved from 67 to 96, and FCP, CLS, and SEO were improved to 0.6 seconds, 0.005, and 100, respectively.</1>

header.title: A Space for Smooth Communication
header.description: A web service where professionals in service development, including planners, developers, and designers, gather to reduce the difficulties of technical communication and get to know each other.

outline.label: Overview
outline.description: <0>Planning Intent</0><1>I planned this community after experiencing the inconvenience of communication through several team projects at school. I observed differences in technical understanding among team members, conflicts arising from these differences, and a lack of knowledge about each other's positions within the team. I wanted to create a space for professionals to ask questions about different positions or roles within the same profession, share the latest trend information, and prepare to build a team together.</1><2>It operates on a postcard-style communication method, allowing users to record text, photos, comments, and create profiles. It includes features such as profile creation, following, and a member ranking system. Profiles are color-coded based on the user's position, and rank and current role information in the industry are displayed for easy identification of the member's role.</2>

implements.label: Implemented Features
description: <0>User</0><1>Normal/Social sign-up, email verification, login, password change/reissue, profile avatar and content creation, user rank, trace (follow), user report, user suspension</1>

<0>Post</0><1>Post creation/deletion/modification/blind, multiple image uploads, image slider, image compression, post sympathy function, comment creation/modification/deletion, post search, hashtag search, infinite scrolling post loading, recommended post loading</1>

issues.label: Issues
issues.description: <0>Data not being added multiple times when scrolling</0><1>Due to the use of the existing scroll method, situations occurred where data loading requests were missing in event handlers with many branching conditions. I applied Intersection Observer, refactored the code, and removed multiple event request methods to improve performance.</1><2>Learn more</2>

slides.title: Infinite Scrolling
slides.description: Improved user experience and distributed transmission of accumulated post data due to service characteristics. Initial loading of 12 posts. As you scroll, an additional 12 posts are loaded.

slides.title: Post Exploration
slides.description: Load all posts containing the desired keyword through search. Clicking on a hashtag loads all posts registered with that hashtag. Blinded posts are excluded from search.

slides.title: Post Upload
slides.description: The topic is the title of the post. It can be uploaded even with blanks, in which case it is displayed as 'No Topic.' You can write text in the post content. Hash tags can be added to the post content, and clicking on them loads posts with the corresponding hash tags.

slides.title: Attach Images
slides.description: You can upload up to 6 images per post (10MB limit per image). Images are stored in S3 with both the original and compressed files for optimization during post data loading. The displayed images in the post are loaded as compressed files, and clicking on the image shows a carousel with the original file.

slides.title: Upload Comments
slides.description: You can enter comments, and editing and deletion are possible.

slides.title: Load Recommended Posts
slides.description: Calculate the number of 'prots' for each square and display the top 3 posts with the most 'prots' at the top of the page. For each square, calculate the number of posts in the question category and display 1 random post at the top of the page. Recommended and question posts are always displayed, even when scrolling.

slides.title: Prot
slides.description: Prot is a function similar to like or empathy. Proting your own posts is prohibited.

slides.title: Trace
slides.description: Trace is a function similar to follow. If you apply to trace a user, it appears in the trace list on your profile. Also, if there are users tracing you, they appear in the tracer list.

slides.title: Post Deletion and Blind (No Comments)
slides.description: There are some restrictions on post deletion for users who have written helpful comments on the post. If there are no comments, pressing delete will notify and, upon confirmation, completely delete the post.

slides.title: Post Deletion and Blind (With Comments)
slides.description: If there are comments, it will be blind processed instead of complete deletion. Blinded posts indicate that the post has been deleted by the author and can be viewed by others at any time. Blinded posts prohibit prots, comments, and editing. The author can restore a blinded post, and while prots and comments functions are restored, editing is prohibited.

slides.title: User Report
slides.description: Post reporting is a report on the author. When a report is requested, the report content, post information, and reporter information are saved. If a user receives 7 cumulative reports, all posts of that user are immediately blinded, and if they receive 14 cumulative reports, the user's service usage, excluding login, is restricted. A user can report another user only once per account.

slides.title: Edit Profile
slides.description: The profile is a page where you can show yourself. The profile displays the user's avatar image, activity history, and public information. If it's not your own page, only the profile banner and activity history are displayed, and if it's your own profile page, additional information is shown. Shared information is displayed on the profile banner and can be viewed by others when visiting your profile. The user's avatar can be changed to an image under 10MB. The user activity history shows uploaded posts and traced lists. Among the public information, the user's job is not changeable. The email ID of personal information and the job information of public information cannot be changed.

slides.title: Change Password
slides.description: Passwords can be changed on the personal information page.

slides.title: User Job
slides.description: Depending on the job selected at the time of signing up, the avatar ring's color displayed at the top of the post is shown differently (Frontend: Yellow, Backend: Green, Design: Red, Planning: Blue). In the profile, you can modify the role section to specify detailed job roles. This feature makes it easy to identify which user uploaded a post based on their job.

slides.title: Rank System
slides.description: There are ranks from 6 to 1, and the Bloo Points required to raise the rank represent the user's participation score. Rank 9 indicates an administrator. The initial state of the rank is 0, and writing one post raises it to Rank 6. When you upload a post or comment, you receive 10 points, and when you receive prots or trace requests, you receive 100 points. If you delete posts or comments, cancel prots, or disconnect traces, the received points are recovered. You do not receive points for commenting on your own post.

slides.title: Sign Up and Login (Regular Account Registration)
slides.description: Registration is only possible through email verification. Regular account registration requires email, username, password, and job information. Email undergoes an authentication process by attempting to send a code to that email. If the code matches, the registration is approved. Once the registration is complete, a user-specific code is assigned. This code can be used when changing user information or password.

slides.title: Sign Up and Login (Social Account Registration)
slides.description: Google and Kakao connection is provided, and the selected login strategy is executed. If you sign up with a social account, you need to additionally enter the username and job information required by the service to use it.

slides.title: Forgot Password
slides.description: For regular account users, if you forget your password, you can obtain a random string temporary password code using the user code sent during registration on the support page (/support).

slides.title: Guide for First-time Users
slides.description: There are ranks from 6 to 1, and the Bloo Points required to raise the rank represent the user's participation score. Rank 9 indicates an administrator. The initial state of the rank is 0, and writing one post raises it to Rank 6. When you upload a post or comment, you receive 10 points, and when you receive prots or trace requests, you receive 100 points. If you delete posts or comments, cancel prots, or disconnect traces, the received points are recovered. You do not receive points for commenting on your own post.

slides.description: Announces new features and changes in the service version.

projectsDevelopment.skills: TypeScript, React.js, SWR, TailwindCSS, Express.js, Sequelize.js, MySQL, Nginx, AWS EC2+S3

header.title: The Fastest Place to Meet People Similar to You
header.description: Real-time data transmission service using socket communication.

outline.label: Overview
outline.description: <0>Project Intent</0><1>A service that allows users to exchange real-time live messages with one or more members using socket communication. BlooWays and Areas are both large and small concept conversation spaces, and users can create multiple conversation spaces, invite desired members, and communicate with members who have similar preferences.</1>

implements.label: Implemented Features
description: <0>BlooWays and Areas (NSP)</0><1>Create BlooWays, create Areas, invite members, real-time message communication, indicate online users, post empathy function, mention members, send images, indicate unread messages, infinite scrolling</1>

issues.label: Issues
issues.description: <0>Notification handling for unreceived messages</0><1>Situations where users in Area A did not receive notifications for messages sent in Area B occurred. Saved the time each user entered each Area and the last time a message was sent, then checked the number of messages whose creation date is later than the sent time using API requests. This resolved the issue.</1><2>View details</2>

slides.title: Member Registration and Login (Regular Account Login)
slides.description: Manage member registration and login with regular and social accounts. Once a member is registered, they are automatically added to the 'All BlooWays' to which all BlooWays members belong.

slides.title: Member Registration and Login (Social Account Login)
slides.description: Manage member registration and login with regular and social accounts. Once a member is registered, they are automatically added to the 'All BlooWays' to which all BlooWays members belong.

slides.title: Create a New BlooWay
slides.description: BlooWay is the largest concept space where members can gather. A BlooWay consists of multiple small spaces called Areas. When invited to a BlooWay, the invited BlooWay is displayed on the member's BlooWay list. You can create a BlooWay by entering the BlooWay name, link, and description. The link is automatically matched with the BlooWay name by default, but users can also enter it manually. For example, if you enter 'chocolate' as the link, the link for this BlooWay will be (https://blooways.online/blooway/chocolate). The description indicates what the created BlooWay is about and is displayed on the right side of the BlooWay name.

slides.title: Invite Members to BlooWay
slides.description: You can register members in the BlooWay member list by email.

slides.title: Create a New Area and Invite
slides.description: An Area is a small concept space (Room) within a BlooWay. You can invite members to an Area, and even if they are members of the same BlooWay, the Area they are not invited to will not be displayed in their list. Private Talk is a space for 1:1 conversation with a member. The list for Private Talk is created targeting members belonging to the same BlooWay. You can create an Area and invite members by entering their email addresses.

slides.title: Real-time Chat with All Members in an Area
slides.description: You can have real-time conversations using socket communication with all members belonging to a specific Area. The demonstration images use two browser windows to simulate the scenario, so if the browser is not focused, it may appear that real-time messages are not being sent. This is normal, as browsers limit some operations in these situations to optimize performance. In actual conversation, each user focuses on their browser, so this is not an issue.

slides.title: Mentioning Members
slides.description: You can mention members in the same Area by entering @. When you enter @, a trigger is activated, displaying the list of members in the current Area. You can create a link to move to a private talk page with the respective member.

slides.title: Sending Images
slides.description: You can send multiple images by clicking the image button at the bottom of the talk input form or by dragging and dropping image files. Clicking on an image opens a carousel for detailed viewing.

slides.title: Checking Unreceived Talks
slides.description: When receiving messages from members in the same Area while not in that Area, the number of messages received will be marked as unread talks. This also applies to private talks.

slides.title: Infinite Scrolling
slides.description: Infinite scrolling is applied for an enhanced user experience and the efficient transmission of large talk data. It loads the initial 20 talks, and when scrolling up, additional talk data is loaded in increments of 20. If new talks are sent during scrolling, a quick view button is created.

slides.title: Responsive Web Screen
slides.description: BlooWays service operates as a 100% responsive web screen, displaying optimized screens on devices of any size.

title: MUG

projectsDevelopment.description: An interactive web service where exhibition information can be easily viewed on one page. The project focuses on implementing user interactions using scroll animations, sorting, and filtering animations.

header.title: A Giant Art Museum at a Glance
header.description: An interactive responsive web service that makes it easy to view exhibition information data on one page.

outline.label: Overview
outline.description: <0>Project Intent</0><1>To check exhibition information from various countries, one usually has to visit each country's page individually, which can be inconvenient for those who want to explore information from multiple countries. To address this, we gathered exhibition information from each country, added visual elements through animations, and implemented filtering features to allow users to selectively view the information they are interested in.</1><1>We collected exhibition data within the allowed scope of the Robot Exclusion Protocol using Python Selenium. This data is designed in card format and loaded onto the page. The project focuses on user interaction, animation implementation, and publishing. When a user requests a page, the controller loads shuffled MongoDB data and transmits it as an object. Pug renders the received data on the page.</1>

implements.label: Implemented Features
description: <0>Common</0><1>Scroll animation, card sorting animation, exhibition name/museum/country search filtering, museum/art gallery filtering, card click animation, responsive web screen</1>

issues.label: Issues
issues.description: <0>Adjusting the position when clicking/closing the card</0><1>There was a need to implement a solution for the issue of the card slowly expanding and centering from its position when clicked and adjusting to the original position when closed. This was addressed by calculating the user's browser viewport size, subtracting the coordinates (X, Y) of the clicked card, and adjusting accordingly.</1><2>View details</2>

It offers various tiramisu packages selected to best suit each village based on their characteristics, colors, shapes, and more, reflecting in the design of the packages and the taste of the products.</1>

implements.label: Implemented Features
description: <0>Common</0><1>Implemented a smooth-scrolling brand introduction page using GSAP. Developed product introduction, shopping cart, and price adjustment functionalities. Implemented user signup, profile creation, and editing functionalities.</1>

issues.label: Issues
issues.description: <0>Implementation of horizontal scrolling and screen snap feature</0><1>The intention is to provide a unique UX where the screen smoothly snaps horizontally instead of vertically as the user scrolls. To achieve this, elements of each section were arranged horizontally, and the GSAP 'to' method was used to set elements to move along the X-axis. The ScrollTrigger's snap and pin properties were used to implement smooth motion when fixing the screen.</1>
